20#include "ZXConfig.h"
21#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"
22#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
23#include "BitHacks.h"
24#endif
25
26#include <cstdint>
27#include <iterator>
28#include <vector>
29#include <algorithm>
30#include <utility>
31
32namespace ZXing {
33
34class ByteArray;
35
36template <typename Iterator>
37struct Range {
38 Iterator begin, end;
39 explicit operator bool() const { return begin < end; }
40 int size() const { return static_cast<int>(end - begin); }
41};
42
43/**
44* A simple, fast array of bits.
45*/
46class BitArray
47{
48#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
49 std::vector<uint8_t> _bits;
50#else
51 int _size = 0;
52 std::vector<uint32_t> _bits;
53#endif
54
55 friend class BitMatrix;
56
57 // Nothing wrong to support it, just to make it explicit, instead of by mistake.
58 // Use copy() below.
59 BitArray(const BitArray &) = default;
60 BitArray& operator=(const BitArray &) = delete;
61
62public:
63
64#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
65 using Iterator = std::vector<uint8_t>::const_iterator;
66#else
67 class Iterator : public std::iterator<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag, bool, int, bool*, bool>
68 {
69 public:
70 bool operator*() const { return (*_value & _mask) != 0; }
71
72 Iterator& operator++()
73 {
74 if ((_mask <<= 1) == 0) {
75 _mask = 1;
76 ++_value;
77 }
78 return *this;
79 }
80
81 Iterator& operator--()
82 {
83 if ((_mask >>= 1) == 0) {
84 _mask = 0x80000000;
85 --_value;
86 }
87 return *this;
88 }
89
90 int operator-(const Iterator& rhs) const
91 {
92 return static_cast<int>(_value - rhs._value) * 32 + (_mask >= rhs._mask
93 ? +BitHacks::CountBitsSet(_mask - rhs._mask)
94 : -BitHacks::CountBitsSet(rhs._mask - _mask));
95 }
96
97 bool operator==(const Iterator& rhs) const { return _mask == rhs._mask && _value == rhs._value; }
98 bool operator!=(const Iterator& rhs) const { return !(*this == rhs); }
99
100 bool operator<(const Iterator& rhs) const
101 {
102 return _value < rhs._value || (_value == rhs._value && _mask < rhs._mask);
103 }
104 bool operator<=(const Iterator& rhs) const
105 {
106 return _value < rhs._value || (_value == rhs._value && _mask <= rhs._mask);
107 }
108 bool operator>(const Iterator& rhs) const { return !(*this <= rhs); }
109 bool operator>=(const Iterator& rhs) const { return !(*this < rhs); }
110
111 private:
112 Iterator(std::vector<uint32_t>::const_iterator p, uint32_t m) : _value(p), _mask(m) {}
113 std::vector<uint32_t>::const_iterator _value;
114 uint32_t _mask;
115 friend class BitArray;
116 };
117#endif
118
119 using ReverseIterator = std::reverse_iterator<Iterator>;
120 using Range = ZXing::Range<Iterator>;
121
122 BitArray() = default;
123
124 explicit BitArray(int size) :
125#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
126 _bits(size, 0) {}
127#else
128 _size(size), _bits((size + 31) / 32, 0) {}
129#endif
130
131 BitArray(BitArray&& other) noexcept :
132#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
133 _size(other._size),
134#endif
135 _bits(std::move(other._bits)) {}
136
137 BitArray& operator=(BitArray&& other) noexcept {
138#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
139 _size = other._size;
140#endif
141 _bits = std::move(other._bits);
142 return *this;
143 }
144
145 BitArray copy() const {
146 return *this;
147 }
148
149 int size() const noexcept {
150#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
151 return Size(_bits);
152#else
153 return _size;
154#endif
155 }
156
157 int sizeInBytes() const noexcept {
158 return (size() + 7) / 8;
159 }
160
161 /**
162 * @param i bit to get
163 * @return true iff bit i is set
164 */
165 bool get(int i) const {
166#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
167 return _bits.at(i) != 0;
168#else
169 return (_bits.at(i >> 5) & (1 << (i & 0x1F))) != 0;
170#endif
171 }
172
173 // If you know exactly how may bits you are going to iterate
174 // and that you access bit in sequence, iterator is faster than get().
175 // However, be extremly careful since there is no check whatsoever.
176 // (Performance is the reason for the iterator to exist in the first place.)
177#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
178 Iterator iterAt(int i) const noexcept { return {_bits.cbegin() + i}; }
179 Iterator begin() const noexcept { return _bits.cbegin(); }
180 Iterator end() const noexcept { return _bits.cend(); }
181
182 template <typename ITER>
183 static ITER getNextSetTo(ITER begin, ITER end, bool v) noexcept {
184 while( begin != end && *begin != static_cast<int>(v) )
185 ++begin;
186 return begin;
187 }
188#else
189 Iterator iterAt(int i) const noexcept { return {_bits.cbegin() + (i >> 5), 1U << (i & 0x1F)}; }
190 Iterator begin() const noexcept { return iterAt(0); }
191 Iterator end() const noexcept { return iterAt(_size); }
192
193 static Iterator getNextSetTo(Iterator begin, Iterator end, bool v) {
194 auto i = begin;
195 // reconstruct _bits.end()
196 auto bitsEnd = end._mask == 0x1 ? end._value : std::next(end._value);
197 if (i._value >= bitsEnd)
198 return end;
199 // mask off lesser bits first
200 auto currentBits = (v ? *i._value : ~*i._value) & ~(i._mask - 1);
201 while (currentBits == 0) {
202 if (++i._value == bitsEnd) {
203 return end;
204 }
205 currentBits = v ? *i._value : ~*i._value;
206 }
207 i._mask = 1 << BitHacks::NumberOfTrailingZeros(currentBits);
208 return i;
209 }
210
211 static ReverseIterator getNextSetTo(ReverseIterator begin, ReverseIterator end, bool v) {
212 while( begin != end && *begin != v )
213 ++begin;
214 return begin;
215 }
216#endif
217
218 Iterator getNextSetTo(Iterator i, bool v) const {
219 return getNextSetTo(i, end(), v);
220 }
221
222 Iterator getNextSet(Iterator i) const { return getNextSetTo(i, true); }
223 Iterator getNextUnset(Iterator i) const { return getNextSetTo(i, false); }
224
225 ReverseIterator rbegin() const noexcept { return ReverseIterator(end()); }
226 ReverseIterator rend() const noexcept { return ReverseIterator(begin()); }
227
228 /**
229 * Sets bit i.
230 *
231 * @param i bit to set
232 */
233 void set(int i) {
234#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
235 _bits.at(i) = 1;
236#else
237 _bits.at(i >> 5) |= 1 << (i & 0x1F);
238#endif
239 }
240
241 /**
242 * Clears all bits (sets to false).
243 */
244 void clearBits() {
245 std::fill(_bits.begin(), _bits.end(), 0);
246 }
247
248 /**
249 * Efficient method to check if a range of bits is set, or not set.
250 *
251 * @param start start of range, inclusive.
252 * @param end end of range, exclusive
253 * @param value if true, checks that bits in range are set, otherwise checks that they are not set
254 * @return true iff all bits are set or not set in range, according to value argument
255 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if end is less than or equal to start
256 */
257#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
258 bool isRange(int start, int end, bool value) const {
259 return std::all_of(std::begin(_bits) + start, std::begin(_bits) + end, [value](uint8_t v) { return v == static_cast<int>(value); });
260 }
261#else
262 bool isRange(int start, int end, bool value) const;
263#endif
264
265 // Little helper method to make common isRange use case more readable.
266 // Pass positive zone size to look for quite zone after i and negative for zone in front of i.
267 // Set allowClippedZone to false if clipping the zone at the image border is not acceptable.
268 bool hasQuiteZone(Iterator i, int signedZoneSize, bool allowClippedZone = true) const {
269 int index = static_cast<int>(i - begin());
270 if (signedZoneSize > 0) {
271 if (!allowClippedZone && index + signedZoneSize >= size())
272 return false;
273 return isRange(index, std::min(size(), index + signedZoneSize), false);
274 } else {
275 if (!allowClippedZone && index + signedZoneSize < 0)
276 return false;
277 return isRange(std::max(0, index + signedZoneSize), index, false);
278 }
279 }
280
281 bool hasQuiteZone(ReverseIterator i, int signedZoneSize, bool allowClippedZone = true) const {
282 return hasQuiteZone(i.base(), -signedZoneSize, allowClippedZone);
283 }
284
285 /**
286 * Appends the least-significant bits, from value, in order from most-significant to
287 * least-significant. For example, appending 6 bits from 0x000001E will append the bits
288 * 0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0 in that order.
289 *
290 * @param value {@code int} containing bits to append
291 * @param numBits bits from value to append
292 */
293#ifdef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
294 void appendBits(int value, int numBits) {
295 for (; numBits; --numBits)
296 _bits.push_back((value >> (numBits-1)) & 1);
297 }
298
299 void appendBit(bool bit) {
300 _bits.push_back(bit);
301 }
302
303 void appendBitArray(const BitArray& other) {
304 _bits.insert(_bits.end(), other.begin(), other.end());
305 }
306
307 /**
308 * Reverses all bits in the array.
309 */
310 void reverse() {
311 std::reverse(_bits.begin(), _bits.end());
312 }
313#else
314 void appendBits(int value, int numBits);
315
316 void appendBit(bool bit);
317
318 void appendBitArray(const BitArray& other);
319
320 /**
321 * Reverses all bits in the array.
322 */
323 void reverse() {
324 BitHacks::Reverse(_bits, _bits.size() * 32 - _size);
325 }
326#endif
327
328 void bitwiseXOR(const BitArray& other);
329
330 /**
331 *
332 * @param bitOffset first bit to start writing
333 * @param numBytes how many bytes to write
334 * @return Bytes are written most-significant bit first. This is the opposite
335 * of the internal representation, which is exposed by {@link #getBitArray()}
336 */
337 ByteArray toBytes(int bitOffset, int numBytes) const;
338
339 friend bool operator==(const BitArray& a, const BitArray& b)
340 {
341 return
342#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
343 a._size == b._size &&
344#endif
345 a._bits == b._bits;
346 }
347};
348
349
350} // ZXing
